messages: 69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (22:15): ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c: i couldn't work out how to decide what strings would be downplayed if we allow javascript1.x.
62c428533830d84fd8bc77bf402512fc (22:22): hi 69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e - do you have a moment for an AppCache question?
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (22:22): sure

62c428533830d84fd8bc77bf402512fc (22:23): 69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e: I can't understand what this note means: "The Document with which the ApplicationCache object is associated can only itself be associated with an 62c428533830d84fd8bc77bf402512fcplication cache if it is in a top-level browsing context."
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (22:23): it's a lie
62c428533830d84fd8bc77bf402512fc (22:24): 69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e: is it that 62c428533830d84fd8bc77bf402512fcpcache used to be tied to a top-level context, but it no longer is?
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (22:24): yeah
62c428533830d84fd8bc77bf402512fc (22:24): 69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e: thanks! would you like me to send an e-mail about this?
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (22:25): i've just removed the note

62c428533830d84fd8bc77bf402512fc (22:25): 69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e: one more question, about 62c428533830d84fd8bc77bf402512fcplication cache selection algorithm - what are the examples of "f the resource is not being loaded as part of navigation of a browsing context" there?
62c428533830d84fd8bc77bf402512fc (22:26): 69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e: I'm having hard time fully understanding this section, as "the resource being downloaded" is not defined in it
62c428533830d84fd8bc77bf402512fc (22:27): s/downloaded/loaded/
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (22:29): e.g. a document downloaded by XHR
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (22:29): there's always a resource being downloaded when the algorithm is invoked
62c428533830d84fd8bc77bf402512fc (22:29): 69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e: will 62c428533830d84fd8bc77bf402512fcplication cache selection algorithm even be invoked for XHR?
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (22:29): sure, it's invoked by the HTML parser
62c428533830d84fd8bc77bf402512fc (22:30): 69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e: ah well, it's just that we don't parse HTML there, only XML
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (22:30): with xhr2 you will
62c428533830d84fd8bc77bf402512fc (22:31): 69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e: am I right that document.write cannot be used to make an html tag with a manifest?
62c428533830d84fd8bc77bf402512fc (22:33): 69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e: as for "there's always a resource being downloaded when the algorithm is invoked" - what about XMLParser?
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (22:34): document.write() could be used to generate a manifest if the docment was document.open()ed first, iirc
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (22:34): as in, if it all came from document.write()
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (22:34): but if you see a <script> tag then you can no longer document.write() the <html> tag
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (22:34): what about XMLParser?
62c428533830d84fd8bc77bf402512fc (22:35): 69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e: that's a way to invoke parser (which will invoke cache selection algorithm) without downloading any resource
62c428533830d84fd8bc77bf402512fc (22:36): 69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e: same for document.write, as you just explained
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (22:36): (actually come to think of if document.open() wouldn't be part of navigation so it wouldn't trigger this)
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (22:37): (it would trigger the If clause you asked about -- the "do nothing" one)
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (22:37): in all the cases where you hit the mentions of "resource being loaded", there is a resource being loaded
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (22:37): because if there wasn't, you would hit the first If clause and bail out

62c428533830d84fd8bc77bf402512fc (22:38): 69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e: hmm, maybe it's good enough for a spec, but formally a clause that says "If the resource is not being loaded as part of navigation of a browsing context" doesn't match if there is no resource
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (22:43): how can there be no resource?
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (22:43): there's always a resource
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (22:43): even if it's just a Document created by createDocument()
62c428533830d84fd8bc77bf402512fc (22:46): 69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e: is "resource" formally defined somewhere? that's not how I understand that
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (22:48): What's the best way to loop over an object (?† la for‚Ä¶in) but sorted in JS?
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (22:53): 62c428533830d84fd8bc77bf402512fc: i'm just using it in the dictionary sense of "asset"
62c428533830d84fd8bc77bf402512fc (22:54): 69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e: so, if a Document created with createDocument is a resource - is any Element a resource, too?
62c428533830d84fd8bc77bf402512fc (22:54): 69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e: to me, a resource is something that can be loaded
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (22:54): 62c428533830d84fd8bc77bf402512fc: *shrug* what terminology would you rather we use here?

62c428533830d84fd8bc77bf402512fc (22:55): 69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e: to me, it would have been much easier if the resource was an explicit input parameter of the algorithm, just like manifest URL is, and it were specified at call sites
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (22:56): i guess i can do that
62c428533830d84fd8bc77bf402512fc (22:56): 69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e: cool, thanks!
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (23:04): done

ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (23:22): a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554: You might need to be careful to do "var quotes = ...", since window.quotes is the element with id="quotes" or something like that
